data.text: Behold, mine eye has seen these things,
And I know all that ye too know;
Nevertheless I will speak to the Lord,
But ye are all bad physicians,
But would that ye were silent,
But hear ye the reasoning of my mouth,
Do ye not speak before the Lord,
Or will ye draw back?
For it were well if he would thoroughly search you:
He will not reprove you at all the less:
Shall not his whirlpool sweep you round,
And your glorying shall prove in the end to you like ashes,
Be silent, that I may speak, and cease from mine anger,
While I may take my flesh in my teeth,
Though the Mighty One should lay hand upon me, forasmuch as he has begun,
And this shall turn to me for salvation;
Hear, hear ye my words,
Behold, I am near my judgment:
For who is he that shall plead with me,
But grant me two things:
Withhold thine hand from me:
Then shalt thou call, and I will hearken to thee:
How many are my sins and my transgressions?
Wherefore hidest thou thyself from me,
Wilt thou be startled at me, as at a leaf shaken by the wind?
For thou hast written evil things against me,
And thou hast placed my foot in the stocks;
I am as that which waxes old like a bottle,
